subject: The child
object: the big dog in the park
sentence: The child feared the big dog in the park.
paragraph: It was a sunny day when the family decided to go to the park. The child played around with balloons while her parents set up the picnic. The child feared the big dog in the park. Remembering it from past visits, she quickly ran to her parents. They comforted her, reminding her that the dog is always on a leash.

subject: The audience

subject: She
sentence: She missed her train by just a few seconds this morning.

subject: The expenses for the banquet
sentence: The expenses for the banquet totaled over five thousand dollars.
paragraph: The event planning committee worked tirelessly for the annual banquet. Invitations were sent well in advance to ensure maximum attendance. The expenses for the banquet totaled over five thousand dollars. It was slightly over budget which concerned the treasurer. They discussed how to manage the extra cost.

subject: The garden
sentence: The garden needed water due to the dry spell last week.
paragraph: The weather had been particularly harsh with no rain for days. Plants started showing signs of stress. The garden needed water due to the dry spell last week. Hoping to save them, the gardener decided to water them manually. It was a temporary solution to a pressing problem caused by the weather.

subject: The traveler

subject: The student

subject: The cabin
paragraph: Nestled in the woods, the cabin was an ideal getaway spot. It was equipped with all modern amenities yet maintained a rustic charm. The cabin sleeps four comfortably. subject: She
sentence: She overheard the secrets of the discussion from her corner seat.
paragraph: The café was bustling with people having their afternoon break. Conversations filled the room, creating a buzz. She overheard the secrets of the discussion from her corner seat. subject: The teacher

subject: The replica

paragraph: The museum displayed an array of artworks that attracted visitors from different places. One section was dedicated to replicas of famous paintings.
